Swing for 30.

Posted By: convolution (1/28/2013 8:30:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A crushing monster.  
  
In one pre-release game, I cast it, and it was like 4/4 initially. The following turn, I cast [Death's Approach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death's Approach), killing a blocker and triggering CA, then followed with [Balustrade Spy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balustrade Spy), milling, and triggering milling again - then went to town with a 17/17, and my opponent had 17 life...  
  
On the other hand, in a second game, it got to like 25/25, but was useless due to having no evasion, my opponent (also Dimir) having [Mortus Strider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mortus Strider)... And luckily, he never got his second black mana, or he would have made a [Grisly Spectacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grisly Spectacle) out of my library...
posts.html:
A crushing monster.

In one pre-release game, I cast it, and it was like 4/4 initially. The following turn, I cast Death's Approach, killing a blocker and triggering CA, then followed with Balustrade Spy, milling, and triggering milling again - then went to town with a 17/17, and my opponent had 17 life...

On the other hand, in a second game, it got to like 25/25, but was useless due to having no evasion, my opponent (also Dimir) having Mortus Strider... And luckily, he never got his second black mana, or he would have made a Grisly Spectacle out of my library...

Posted By: Lord_of_Tresserhorn (1/28/2013 2:26:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy plus [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova) wrecked at the prerelease. He was always at least a 6/6 for five, and giving him evasion could push that easily to 9/9 or 10/10. Swinging with just a single creature while you build board presence was also good in the format considering that the most played sweeper was [Aetherize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aetherize), and it isn't as playable on a single attacker.

posts.post_content:
So, looking at Cipher's wording a little more closely, I just realized the way it works is by re-casting the cipher spell every time that guy hits an opponent. That means every cipher triggers this guy's ability again.  
  
Won me the game every single time I got him out in pre-release. He's your best friend alongside [Duskmantle Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duskmantle Guildmage).
posts.html:
